meanings.definition: To pull or drag with force
meanings.sent1: She was haling the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen were haling the net out of the water.
meanings.sent3: The dog was haling its owner towards the park to play fetch.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind was haling the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: The workers were haling the cart up the steep hill with great effort.

meanings.definition: The act of pulling or dragging with force
meanings.sent1: The haling of the sled was challenging due to the snow's depth.
meanings.sent2: The haling of the ship's anchor required teamwork from the crew.
meanings.sent3: The haling of the stubborn donkey made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The haling of the curtains open revealed a beautiful sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The haling of the heavy load strained the workers' muscles.
